edu.rit.gpu

Class GpuStructVbl<T extends Struct>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.gpu.GpuVbl
      • edu.rit.gpu.GpuStructVbl<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Java data type. Class T must extend class Struct.

    public class GpuStructVbl<T extends Struct>
extends GpuVbl
    Class GpuStructVbl provides a struct GPU variable. This is a variable of a C struct type stored in the GPU's memory and mirrored in the CPU's memory. Class GpuStructVbl provides operations for copying the variable from the CPU to the GPU or from the GPU to the CPU.

    To use a struct GPU variable:

    1. Write a Java class that extends class Struct, to mirror the fields of the C struct data type.

    2. Construct an instance of class GpuStructVbl by calling the getStructVbl() method on a Gpu object or the getStructVbl() method on a Module object.

    3. Construct a new instance of the Java class with the desired state and assign it to the item field. Call the hostToDev() method to copy the variable from CPU memory to GPU memory.

    4. Pass the GpuStructVbl object as an argument of a GPU kernel function call. In the GPU code, this becomes a pointer (type struct T*) to the variable. The GPU code sets the variable to the desired state.

    5. Call the devToHost() method to copy the variable from GPU memory to CPU memory. Examine the item field's state.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      T item
      The mirrored struct variable in CPU memory.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void devToHost()
      Copy this GPU variable from the GPU device's memory to the host CPU's memory.
      void hostToDev()
      Copy this GPU variable from the host CPU's memory to the GPU device's memory.
